inn1.comm: Lee's a bit straight first up and Strauss works the ball off his pads to the fielder at short fine leg, that's an odd field placement for the new ball
played from the crease towards the leg side
pitches on a good length just outside off and Strauss lets it go through, that was clocked at 143 kph
straighter line on off stump, Strauss gets behind the line and blocks
Strauss lets another one go outside off, 144 kph
Lee pitches wider outside off and Strauss shoulders arms again, 145 kph to end the maiden over
Tait's first ball is full and on the pads, Prior clips it over the in field at square leg
full again and straighter, Prior plays on the leg side towards midwicket
144 kph on a line just outside off, Strauss is really taking his time here, lets another one go
and he's away, by flicking a full ball through square
149 kph and Prior hangs his bat out outside off before trying to pull it away, Tait screams past the outside edge with a short of a length delivery
wide outside off and Prior lets it go this time
just a bit of room outside off, and Strauss shapes up for his favouite cut shot, but ends up hitting the ball into the ground

almost as if he was expecting the short delivery, Strauss rocks back and pulls it in a flash over midwicket, but could not get enough on the shot to clear the ropes, and Johnson running in from deep square leg puts in a dive to save a run

another quick short one from Lee arrives, and Prior gets into a bit of a tangle as he looks to ride the bounce, and ends up jabbing at the delivery that rears up at his throat, fortunately for him, it goes in no man's land
he pitches it fuller this time, and Prior gets forward to drive to mid off
now he opens the face a touch to drive to short extra cover
continues to  nicely come forward and find the middle of the blade, but now it's extra cover's turn to come in the way of the ball
the pace is right up there from Tait, at 149 kph, but the radar is still awry, this one is way outside off stump
similar pace, and much better line, closer to off stump, Strauss has a close look, and decides to leave it alone
149.9 kph and moving in on leg stump, off the pads to the right of short fine

Prior gets away, it was a peach of a bouncer from Tait, climbed on Prior before he could figure out what to do with it, ended up pulling it ungainly in the end, but the ball looped up lazily to fall in front of the square leg umpire, and he was the only man in that area
played back to the bowler from the crease
Strauss gets going nicely, gets to the pitch of this full and widish delivery outside off, and sends it crashing through extra cover along the ground
Prior in to the act now, takes a walk down the pitch, and slams a length Lee delivery through extra cover for another boundary
the slower one from Lee arrives, and Prior pinches a single wide of mid on
Strauss is getting into position neatly for the short stuff from Lee, pulls another one in the air, but Johnson is there on the deep square boundary, and a run is all he gets

Prior's charmed existence continues, he gets in to another mess trying to pull a steepler, but would you believe it, this one balloons up over just over the man at short fine and rolls away for a couple
length delivery, guided to the left of point for a quick single
a bit fuller, he brings down his bat in front of pad and plays it out to extra cover
150 kph length delivery from Tait in the channel around off stump, Prior is stuck on the crease and chooses to have a waft, the ball curves away past his limp prod, boy, talk about luck
too straight delivery, tucked away off the pads behind square
the England captain gets a lot of width in his area outside off, and cuts it high in the air wide of the man at third man for a boundary
gets a length ball on the pads and clips it towards midwicket
Tait squares up Prior with a ball that straightens a shade around middle and leg, but Prior gets enough bat on it to defend it towards mid off
146 kph and fullish on the stumps, his bat turns in his hands, and he mistimes the drive to mid on
147.5 kph on the pads, asking for trouble with fine leg in the ring, Strauss helps it to the left of that man, and there is no chance for the fielder to stop that one
pushed away to extra cover, a quick run is on the cards, and duly taken
waits for this length ball to come on around off stump, and guides it to point

decides to go through covers with the lofted shot, David Hussey was in the way at short extra cover, and it was struck so hard that it went through his hands, good for him, otherwise we could have had another addition to the injury list
goes for the cut to a 150.3 kph shortish delivery, and is beaten by the extra bounce on that one
gets on top of the bounce this time and steers it to the left of point for a run
139.9 kph full delivery going across the batsman, who gets forward and drives to the left of mid off for a single
143.3 kph delivery that goes down the leg side, that would have been a wide had it not been a no-ball, free hit coming up England's way

backs away outside leg but Johnson follows him with a short one, well bowled, he gets a top edge as he has a whack at it, and the ball falls short of the man at deep square leg, makes no difference anyways

Prior has run out of luck finally this innings, and to an absolute beauty from Johnson, it was fullish, swinging in from around off stump, and Prior played all around it, and the ball crashed in to off stump, Johnson strikes in his first over
defended towards the off side off the front foot
leaves it alone outside off stump, good carry for Johnson
angles it across the right-hander, and Trott lets it go safely
stands on the back foot, and punches the back of a length ball towards extra cover
pitches it fuller, and he gets forward to push it to mid off
gets on top of the short delivery dug in to the body, and pulls it in to the ground towards deep square leg
147.3 kph lifter from Lee, Trott pushes at it outside off stump, and is lucky he got an edge thick enough to send the ball safely wide of slip towards third man
gets a full one on the pads, and clips it emphatically to deep square leg
takes a step forward and pushes a length ball towards mid off
driven wide of mid off for the most comfortable of singles
short, wide, angling away outside off, Trott cannot capitalise, and cuts it straight to point
bang on middle stump, he gets the bat in front of pad to work it away to midwicket
cuts down the pace a shade, at 132.6 kph, and has Strauss playing early at one that comes in to him and strikes high on the pads
hello, after having played so cleanly and correctly till now, Strauss backs away outside leg and has an ugly swipe at a back of a length delivery, and misses completely
guided to backward point, he thinks about a single, but it was possible only in thought and not in action
starts off with a back of a length ball outside off that is steered wide of third man for a single
short of a good length delivery on the stumps, played back to the bowler
looks so gentle after the much quicker trio that bowled before him, played out to mid off
bowls it fuller around off, Strauss is already making room outside leg, and cracks it to sweeper cover
walks around two feet outside off stump, wanting to work this one through midwicket, and is beaten
good slower one to finish a steady first over, Trott gets well forward to defend in to the off side
Strauss goes downtown, makes some neat room outside leg stump, and lifts a full delivery straight over Johnson's head and into the boundary, made such good contact on that occasion
defended back to the bowler
Strauss creates space outside leg yet again, this time Johnson fires it in the blockhole, and Strauss digs it out over the bowler's head
gets outside the line of this short of a length ball around middle, and whips it through square leg for a run
where did this come from? Johnson attempted a slower one, and it goes woefully wrong, bouncing three feet outside leg stump
right on target next ball, clipped away through midwicket
Trott eases in to the front foot drive, but hits the ball straight to point
defended close, too close to the stumps in fact, off the back foot
gets one on the pads, and flicks it past square leg for a useful couple
Strauss targets cow corner with a swing across the line, but the ball rolls away off the bottom half of the blade to mid on
some extra bounce for Hastings, Strauss gets on top of it, and guides it to third man
rushed down the track trying to crash the ball through covers, but got a bottom edge that scooted away in the direction of third man
worked wide of short fine leg for a single
right in the blockhole, dug out hurriedly down the ground
goes on the back foot and works this one away wide of midwicket
Strauss connects, and very cleanly too, took a step or two down the track, and swung through the short delivery, and it was picked up from the deep midwicket boundary
stays in the crease expecting the fullish delivery, and clips it in the air over midwicket, some excited cries from the fielders, but he was safe
Strauss is getting impatient here, backs away and has a go at a length delivery, fortunately for him, it rolls away limply to mid on
better this time from the England captain, remains on the crease and works it away behind point
meanwhile, Strauss continues to have a go, and keeps connecting mostly, it was a short delivery asking to be hit, and he pulled it behind square leg in a flash
slower one sprayed wide down the leg side
guided wide of backward point for another single
wants to slam this one through covers, but ends up bottom edging it close to the stumps on the crease
finds extra cover with the drive off the front foot
walks across and outside off stump, and whips a length delivery through square leg
gets outside the line of this one on middle and leg, and works it to the right of short fine leg to move on to 49
full delivery clipped away to deep midwicket along the ground
brings up his 50 with a meditated paddle down to fine leg, has been a fluent innings
now Trott with the reverse paddle to a very full ball outside off, but short third man cuts it off
shorter, and he goes back to work it through square leg
the runs keep coming, another one worked away through midwicket
better delivery on the stumps, defended back to the bowler
tossed up full delivery, driven down to long on for a single
floated up on middle, clipped away through midwicket
a touch short, some turn there for Smith, Trott makes a mess of the pull, hitting it in to the ground
lovely free flowing drive through extra cover off the front foot, and there are huge empty spaces in that area
played out in to the on side
more turn for Smith but a touch short and allows him to rock back and cut it to sweeper cover
brings out the reverse lap shot to a full toss and gets it very fine behind the wicket on the off side
eased down to long on for a run
guided wide of point for another single
now Strauss with the reverse sweep, Hastings dives over the ball, and lets it go through
looks for the tap-and-run to covers. but manages only the tap
this time he manages both, working the ball in to the gap in front of cover for a single
stays back to a fullish one and punches it towards cover
lines up for the pull to a short one and almost hits it down the throat of the man at deep midwicket, bounces just in front of him
cut away through point
driven down to long off
slaps a shortish one in front of cover and trots through for a run
squeezed out to point, and this time there will be no single for them
defended down the track off the back foot
cannot get the ball past square leg
goes off side in the search for a single, and gets one through covers
played back to the bowler, no room to do anything but that
full toss, smashed down the ground to long on
now Trott targets long on for another single
swept away wide of fine leg for a couple, neat accumulation
fuller on the stumps, pushed back down the track
Callum saves the boundary on the deep midwicket fence, it was smashed and was traveling very quickly
eased down the ground towards long off
on the back foot to a shortish one, and slaps it away to sweeper cover
stays in the crease and punches in the region of long on
tapped in front of the wicket on the off side, and they go through for the run even as Haddin runs in and fields
gets another single on the on side, does Strauss
gets a full toss, and swings it over midwicket for a boundary, deservedly despatched
played out in to the on side
whipped away off the back foot and down to long on
eased in to the gap wide of sweeper cover for a couple, just a bit tight in the end, but mostly safe
tossed up full on middle, and pushed back past Smith down the ground

Strauss comes rushing down the track, and finds the man at short midwicket with his attempted lofted stroke, it was teasingly tossed up, Strauss took the bait, and hit it straight to David Hussey who throws the ball gleefully in the air after taking a neat catch
gets on the back foot and gets in to a tangle as he tried to work it away through midwicket
driven down the ground and he is away
gets a full delivery, and goes down on a knee to sweep it in the gap behind square leg
punched down the ground to long on, Smith thought he had a chance to stop it, but hadn't counted for KP who was in the way, crashed straight in to him, and went down
full, fizzing delivery but way outside off stump, squeezed away to point
drops it marginally short, and he is quick to go back and pull it along the ground to deep midwicket
raps him on the pads with a very full one but that was going down the leg side
another full delivery, this time around off stump, he leans out and finds extra cover with the drive
length ball outside off stump, steered to third man off the back foot
gets a full toss but hits it straight to Hussey at midwicket, who then concedes a run by throwing the ball towards Haddin, third man tidies up
misses out on another full toss, flicks it right to midwicket who makes a tumbling stop
cannot get the fullish ball past midwicket again
short, wide, turning further away, and slapped away to sweeper cover
cut away fiercely backward of point off the back foot
dances down the track, takes it on the full, and pings long on
yet another single in the direction of long on, Smith has been mostly either too full or too short
drives this full delivery past a diving extra cover for a couple of runs
Tait shortens the length just a touch, and he stays in the crease and guides it to point
144 kph near-yorker around off, dug out in the region of point
slow full toss, cannot get it away, eases it to the man at mid on
short one this time, pulled away without any fuss at all to deep midwicket
gets in to an awkward position as he tries to drive this full delivery angled in around leg stump, and gets a but of bat on to his leg as he goes through with the shot, the ball rolls away to mid on
leans out to push this one in front of cover
thumped down to long off
gets a safe top edge wide of fine leg as he goes for the sweep shot
full ball driven to extra cover
flat and quick, turning in from leg stump, pushed back to the bowler
looks to guide this fullish one in to the gap between point and short third man off the front foot, but cannot beat point
bowls a full delivery that is hit down to long off
driven down to long on for a single
takes it on the full and sweeps it wide of fine leg for a couple, and that will be 50 for Jonathan Trott
worked to the right of  midwicket for a run
whipped off the front foot to long on, Trott is feeling the heat out there in the middle
punched down to long off for another single
as calmly as one can loft down the ground, Trott lifts Smith straight over his head for a boundary, waltzed down the track, and got nicely to the pitch
gets away with it, it was turning away and cut in the air, but just short of backward point, Trott lives on
driven down to long on, Smith finds KP in the way again as he looks to stop the ball
now KP charges down, takes this one on the full and hits it to long on
rocks back and slaps this shortish one away to sweeper cover
KP decides to have a swing and fortunately for him did not hit it powerfully enough to carry to long on, goes to him on the bounce
plants the front foot out and drives a length ball to long off
shimmies across the stumps, and sends this one down to fine leg with a flick of the wrists
114.4 kph short ball, pleading to be smashed, KP obliges, pulling it wide of deep midwicket who runs towards it in vain
much fuller and around off stump, he waits for it to arrive and defends it down the track
there is a man at sweeper cover, and he runs hard, but there is so much power on the cut from KP that he had no chance to cut it off as it crashed in to the ropes, poor shortish ball from Hastings
clipped through midwicket for a single to retain the strike
steady length delivery around off stump, calmly defended
KP nearly runs himself out, he hurried down the track, and tried to bash this one down the ground, the throw from extra cover missed the stumps, and KP gets away
lovely flick from Trott off a full one on the pads, but a good diving stop at midwicket concedes only a run
KP whips furiously backward of square leg and gets a single
Trott goes down the track, and pushes a length ball to long off for another run
wristily flicked backward of square leg for an uncomfortable couple for KP, he is limping a bit while running, and calls right away for some help
back of a length around leg stump, worked away off the back foot past the square leg umpire
KP is constantly going down the track, and this time goes for an awkward pull as Hastings bangs it in short
thumped down the ground towards mid off, they are looking to cut loose now
loopy slow short delivery, by the times it goes over Trott's head, he was done with the pull, and watched it go through to Haddin
another slower one, much fuller now, he tries to force it through cover, but bottom edges it into the ground
yet another slower one, he bowls them with good control, cannot do much with it other than push it towards long off for a run
finds the boundary he had been looking for for some time now, gets a full ball on middle and lifts it over midwicket and in to the gap
Watson shortens the length, and he waits for it to arrive and guides it past backward point
KP flails at a fullish one way outside off, and gets a thick edge that flies down in the air to third man, backward point grimaces
eased away to sweeper cover for another single, England have built this one up for a huge finish
extra bounce from outside off stump, he brings it down and the ball scoots to point
backs away to cut, but is beaten on the shot, the ball was a touch too close to off for that one
waits for this length delivery, and dabs it down very late to third man
113.7 kph slow bouncer, KP is surprised by it, and lets it go in the end over his head
101.5 kph this time, slower and slower, KP tries to do something cute, and goes for the sweep from way outside off stump, and misses
this time he smashes this length delivery wide of sweeper cover
eased down the ground for a single to long on
gets it in the blockhole, lovely variation from the bowler, that's what you need on this road, jabbed away down to long on

and the Powerplay jinx continues! Lee pitched on a good length around off stump, Pietersen tried to go over mid-off, the bat turned in his hand as he mis-timed it and he couldn't clear the fielder at mid-off. Steven Smith took a simple catch at waist height
Bell guides his first ball in the air but behind the fielder at point for a single
Lee swings a full ball into the right-hander, Trott pushes to mid-on for a single
full and straight from Lee, Bell pushes the ball towards extra cover and calls Trott through
short ball, Trott gets inside the line by moving a bit to the off and helps the ball past the fielder at short fine leg
he's lucky this time, the ball bounces a bit more from short of a length outside off and Trott edges it wide of the wicketkeeper for four more
short and wide outside off stump, begging to be cut and Bell obliges, placing the ball through the in field at point ... so England have got going after that Pietersen wicket
played off the front foot towards cover, the length was a bit full
a short of a length ball jumps at Bell, who also jumps in his crease while steering the ball towards third man
full ball angling into middle stump, Bell leans across and clips it through midwicket

a full ball angles into the right-hander, beats Trott's attempted flick and crashes into the pad, the umpire upholds the appeal and gives Trott his marching orders. Trott asks for the review because he thinks that was missing leg stump. It was missing leg stump and the decision is overturned.
a searing yorker to end the over. Trott is up to it, though, and digs it out in the nick of time
played with soft hands towards point for a quick single, the fielder charges in but fails to pick up cleanly
a good length delivery angling into the right-hander, Trott stays in his crease and plays towards midwicket
Bell jumps up in his crease to get on top of the bounce and then opens the face to steer a short ball towards third man
fuller length just outside off, Trott drives towards mid-off
Bell also pushes the ball towards mid-off for another single
superb deftness, Trott waits for the ball to angle into him before opening the face of the bat late and guiding the ball fine to the third-man boundary
more width from Tait and Bell plays a well-timed cut towards wide third man where Lee has to run to his left and slide to save the boundary
there's no saving this one though, too full outside off and Bell plays a sweetly-timed cover drive and pierces the in-field
pushed on the leg side
Bell drops the ball towards point and there's a mix-up between the batsman before Trott decides to run the single. Smith had lots of time to line up the throw and he missed. Trott was short by yards
left alone outside off stump
played with an open face towards point
full ball outside off stump, driven through cover for a single
the slower ball, full and straight, driven towards mid-on for a single
short of a length and straight, nudged off the back foot towards midwicket
flicked, supremely, all along the ground to the square leg boundary. Poor line from Lee, too far on leg stump
Trott chops the ball towards third man with minimal footwork
full and straight, Bell waits for the ball in his crease and drives towards mid-off
defended on the off side
that's short and it is also down leg side. One of the easier wide calls to make
good length delivery angling across the right-hander, driven off the back foot through cover point
flicked off the pads through the gap at midwicket
Trott stays on the back foot and plays a short of a length ball towards point
Trott walks right across his stumps to whip a ball from off through midwicket
Bell takes one step down, and then another, and whack, plays a flowing shot, lofting the ball over the fielder at mid-on. Smooth follow through and clean connection
full ball outside off and Trott plays a fluent drive to long-off
played towards cover for another single
Trott moves on to 99 by steering a good length delivery from outside off towards third man
Bell turns the strike over with another steer to third man
played off the front foot towards White at point
Trott ambles his 100th run after driving a length delivery through cover. He raises his bat to an appreciative dressing room. He's set England up for a fabulous score
Trott makes room by moving forward and towards leg and slaps the ball through cover for four
short of a length on leg stump and Trott pulls the ball to long leg
too full on the pads, Bell flicks crisply towards long leg
full delivery on the blockhole outside off, played towards point
that wasn't short at all but Trott moves across and plays a short-arm pull through square. Trott does the calling for the runner and wants two
Trott steps out and latches on to the width offered to slash the ball over point for four. Terrible length and the line wasn't too hot either
played towards cover on the front foot
played from the crease into the off side once again
Bell threads the back-foot punch through cover
cut off the back foot towards point and Trott calls strongly for the single to be taken by Prior and Bell
Bell moves right across his stumps outside off, gets down low on one knee, and scoops a length ball over the head of the fielder at short fine leg
full ball wide outside off, Bell misses the cut. It was rather wide
full and straight, Trott makes room and drives fluently to long-on
the slower ball but its line is haywire, wide outside off stump
Bell aims for over the off side but his drive results in an outside edge that passes short third man. Ferguson gives chase and saves one
driven down the ground for two more
Trott inside-edges the legcutter on the leg side, he was looking to hit on the off
Bell moves across his stumps and plays the paddle from outside off past the fielder at short fine leg
length delivery and Bell swats it powerfully towards midwicket where Watson jumps up on the edge of the circle and gets fingertips on the ball, tough chance
Trott slogs the ball high and far over midwicket and the ball bounces just inside the boundary before going over
dropped, Trott slams a full ball right back at Watson and he couldn't hold on to a tough catch at chest height
Trott tries to steer the ball through the off but gets beaten
Trott gets down on one knee and swats the ball in front of midwicket
full toss wide outside off stump, Bell stays in his crease and plays towards deep point
low full toss on off stump and Trott hits the ball through square leg for one more
full and wide outside off stump, Trott made room and then couldn't play a shot
short ball outside off stump, Trott lashes at it and top edges it high towards third man where it falls short of the fielder
Trott aims to pulls a full toss towards midwicket but gets an inside edge towards fine leg
full and straight, Trott tries to find the straight boundary but his timing is off
another short ball outside off, Trott misses the slash and the runner and Bell sneak a bye as Haddin collects
caught, Bell makes room to hit a full ball through the off side but hits it flat and hard right at Clarke at extra cover
length delivery angling across the left-hander, Morgan drives through cover
length ball angling into the left-hander from round the wicket and Morgan swings it high and far into the gap at deep midwicket, one-bounce and four
full and wide outside off, Morgan reaches for it and takes England to 299 with a single on the off side
that's too wide outside off stump, England reach 300
full toss and Trott hits it down to long-on with a flat bat
a fast one in the blockhole outside off stump, Morgan gets beaten
short ball and Morgan goes for the hook, the connection is not quite clean but the ball flies off the top edge to the fine leg boundary
low full toss outside off stump, Morgan reaches for it and plays on the off side for one
Morgan moves right across his stumps to clip a full ball off his pads over square leg to the fielder in the deep
Trott plays the ball towards midwicket and then grimaces and holds his back
a high full toss, not very high though, and Trott hits the ball towards long-off with a flat bat
low full toss and Morgan moves across and plays the ball through square leg
short ball and Trott pulls off the front foot towards midwicket where Lee fields
that's a good ball, the yorker, and Morgan plays on the off
Watson bowls a slower one outside off and Morgan plays the ball into the off side, Australia concede an overthrow with a ricochet from a direct hit at the bowler's end
yorker, and Trott can only dig it out on the off side
Morgan mis-times the big hit on the leg side and ends up playing it back to Watson
fantastic shot, Morgan moves his front foot out of the way and launches a full ball right back over Watson's head. He nearly clears the boundary

caught at short third man. Morgan whipped around to get into position to play the reverse swat and make good contact with the length ball too. He hit it in the air, though, and straight to Tait in the circle
he aims for midwicket first ball but the length is too full and he inside-edges it on to the pad
a low full toss and Collingwood works the ball through midwicket
Tait bowls a full toss that is nearly waist high and Collingwood pulls the ball to deep midwicket
Trott clears his front foot and lifts a full ball from Tait from off stump over White at mid-on, the fielder had just been brought into the circle
driven to deep cover for a single
Collingwood misses the pull and gets hit by a full toss high on the thigh but just below the box, ouch. And Collingwood can feel that as he runs through
short ball and Trott falls after top edging a pull shot. He made room and skied it, Tait called for the catch and took it cleanly
forced through midwicket and the batsmen run hard to take three off the final ball, Collingwood limps off the field after the final ball. He's still hurting from that Tait full toss

inn2.comm: well, that's one way to start! Woakes searches for swing with the new ball, floating it right up outside off, but Watson simply leans forward to caress a drive to the cover boundary. Australia up and running
that's ugly, sprayed well down the leg side and Prior never had a chance
Watson steps confidently forward and aims a muscly drive right at mid-on
on a decent length, but quite wide of off and Watson is in no trouble chopping down to third man
Haddin's off the mark straight away, simply laying bat on one and sending the ball dribbling into the leg side. It's wide of mid-on, and so an easy single
is that a better length with virtually no swing on offer? Woakes jams this one into the pitch to have Watson hopping back to defend to point
pushed to point once more, off the front foot this time
interesting start, Anderson pitches it right up in the blockhole first ball. Dug out, not much swing
there is some seam movement though, as this one jags back in off the pitch. Just short of a good length, hitting the pitch hard
a bit of wobble in to the batsman through the air, clipped gently into the leg side for one
good length but just a bit too straight from Anderson, and now Watson picks up a single with a nudge into the leg side
tapped towards mid-on, not hit with much power so there's time for them to sprint through for one
a low, swinging full toss is worked into the leg side to end the over
this is a shaky start from Woakes, again he goes back of a length but speared down the leg side. Watson just gets a touch on it, sending the ball fine of the man at wide leg slip to pick up four
chopped wide of gully for one
slightly ungainly defence from Haddin, he's almost playing French cricket as he defends flat-footed into the covers
this time he's nicely in line and defending down the track
well, this one's hit the seam and left the batsman off the pitch. Haddin is totally squared up and a thick outside edge squirts behind square on the off side
slap! Dismissive stroke from Watson, seizing on a short, wide delivery and crashing it away through point
Haddin joins in, as he too is offered a short, wide gift from Anderson. The batsman accepts happily, rocking back to crack a cut in front of point
pulled this time, not altogether convincingly however and that wasn't too far from the man in catching at short midwicket
forced off the back foot into the off side, but straight to the fielder
Haddin sets himself for the booming cover drive, but is perhaps too enthusiastic in the shot as the ball takes a thick inside edge and ricochets off the pad
punched just wide of mid-off, and they have time to nip through for a quick single
these two batsmen matching each other shot for shot, now Watson is too early into a drive and inside edges back down the track...
just short of a length to start, tucked into the covers
cracking delivery from Finn, an outswinger that hits the pitch and moves further away to beat the outside edge of Haddin's bat

sloppy stuff in the field - and from James Anderson of all people. Haddin popped a drive in the air just wide of Strauss at short extra cover, Anderson charged round in the covers but as he slid to field kicked the ball further away to allow the runs
driven hard, straight to mid-off
Finn trudges nonplussed back to his mark as the ball is hit right between point and cover, bisecting both diving fielders
good finish, keeping Haddin deep in the crease and defending
Watson is in dominant mood, lifting a length delivery outside off up and over cover point. Didn't bother trying to keep it down, just scythed through the line
four more, he was aiming for the late cut but hit it rather finer than perhaps he was hoping. The edge flies just wide of an airborne Prior and away for four
three in a row! Watson was aiming for deep midwicket but the ball takes the top edge of the bat and flies down to third man once again
good comeback - eventually - from Anderson, a perfectly pitched outswinger beating the outside edge
well, that was short-lived. Watson is on the attack once more, sending the ball racing away through cover point with a crunching cut

big over for Australia, everything going Watson's way at the moment. This could so easily have ended up in the hands of the fielder, Watson is turned inside-out by another outswinger but the ball lands safely and rolls away
flicked to midwicket for one
Haddin hops back and defends to cover

brave running! Haddin punches almost straight to Anderson at mid-off and sets off, the pick-up and throw are good but not good enough - the ball goes wide and Haddin slides safely into the crease with a dive
guided down to third man off the face of the bat
length delivery, just outside off and now Haddin runs down to third man
Watson attacks into the leg side, lifting the ball high into the air ... Wright charges round from deep midwicket, the ball bounces safely at wide long-on and evades his despairing dive!

as the lacquer's come off the new ball it's just started to move around a bit more - Haddin is undone by an outswinger from Anderson, playing too early and driving in the air ... but wide of the fielder!
another chance! Watson this time, driving much too early. The ball dips just in front of a leaping Andrew Strauss, it was a really tough chance but he could have got the fingers under that one
glanced down to fine leg
thick outside edge as Watson aims a front-foot pull into the leg side, the ball loops up ever so gently and falls short of third man. An eventful over!
fuller, driven by Haddin. He can't find the gap in the field this time

Trott is back on the field and back into action with a tremendous, diving catch at short fine leg! Leg stump half-volley from Anderson, begging to be put away and Haddin gets nicely into position to flick to fine leg. The ball goes in the air, however, and Trott goes airborne to pull off a great catch. He's still got some juice in the legs then! That'll lift England
a hard run two to start, Watson clipping right between the two men on the leg boundary and pushing for the second. Good running
driven hard back to the bowler
punched down to long-on
full and straight from Yardy, solidly defended
Ferguson is up and away, cutting nicely behind square. Some tag-team fielding on the boundary saves runs
worked to the right of the mid-on fielder, a quick single the result
Finn hits the deck hard, Ferguson defends to backward point
forced away through gully and down to third man for one
Watson stays deep in the crease and defends into the off side
fuller from Finn, targeting the pads. Watson nudges to leg but a tumbling short midwicket negates any thought of a run
this one hits the seam and moves appreciably back in off the pitch. Good bounce too, taking the splice of the bat
good finish to the over, Finn hitting a good length and a nice, straight line. Watson can't get him away and will have to wait a bit longer for his 19th ODI fifty
wristily worked out into the deep on the leg side
full, watchful defence
there's the fifty for Watto, and from just 32 balls. Driven down to long-on, and a warm ripple of applause greets the landmark
Yardy giving the batsmen no room to work with, clipped straight to square leg
glanced to short fine leg this time, again no run to be had
Ferguson finds some space on the off side for a quick single to keep the strike
short of length and rising on Ferguson, who pushes to point
slightly too straight, worked round the corner for a quick single
straight-ish again, Watson gets across to off and nurdles to midwicket for one
Ferguson doesn't look entirely convincing when the ball is rising up at his chest, this time he stands at the crease and tries to work to leg, but the ball goes nowhere
Finn keeping the ball relatively short, Ferguson can't get it away
thrashed through cover! Ferguson backs right away to give himself room as Finn goes fuller, he gets a great connection and the ball is across the boundary in a flash

Yardy strikes! Great catch from Andrew Strauss. Another fifty-and-out for Watson, he was aiming to whip through the leg side but hit the ball in the air. Strauss, at short midwicket, leapt to his right to pluck the ball out of the air. A timely wicket for England
Johnson is off the mark straight away, dropping the ball in front of point
wide and much too short from Yardy, he's got protection on the cover boundary for Ferguson though
glanced down to fine leg
speared down the leg side, the ball flicks the pad and trickles down to fine leg
good finish to the over, accurate stuff from Yardy and Ferguson can't get him away
good length from Finn, zoning in on the top of off stump. Johnson defends
Johnson gets himself in position to work to leg, but a touch of seam movement means he ends up playing the ball gently back down the wicket
intelligent batting from Johnson. He knew there was no-one out on the off side, Finn pitches one up and he immediately scoops up and over cover point. Strong shot
quick single, drop-an-run into the covers by Johnson
nicely flicked off the hip by Ferguson, and they take a single as the ball rolls to square leg
quiet end to the over, Johnson defends to leg
tapped down behind square on the off side for one

that's what he's in for! Johnson bends into a mighty slog-sweep, missing the ball by acres however. Big appeal from Prior as he's struck on the pad, but that was highly optimistic. HawkEye confirms missing leg
another heave into the leg side, this time the ball takes a thick inside edge
Ferguson is working the ball around nicely, another quick single
slapped hard out to the man at long leg, all along the ground though
hurled down on a leg-stump line by Yardy, Ferguson gets a little tickle on it to send the ball down towards fine leg
Johnson props forward and opens the face of the bat to pick up a single behind point
flat outside off, but decent revs on the ball. Ferguson, not quite sure what to expect, defends slightly awkwardly
spinning in and bouncing quite sharply, but Ferguson goes deep in the crease and works to leg
Johnson happy to simply accept singles with the field spread at the moment, again dropping the ball into the off side and setting off
floated up slower and fuller, the ball dips and grips to take a thick inside edge roll into the leg side. The fielder rushes in but he can't stop the single

huge! It was always simply a matter of time for Johnson, especially with KP bowling. He charges down the track and heaves into the leg side, the ball comes right out of the middle and sails into the crowd
plenty of flight here and Ferguson leans out to push a single through cover
quicker - all Johnson can do is defend

now then, what's happened here? Johnson has taken a big swing, Prior takes the bails off and then doesn't seem to bother appealing. It's almost as if he thinks Johnson has been bowled, but clearly that hasn't happened. Prior has taken the bails off with Johnson's foot completely grounded - and he's not out. Very odd.
another quick one angles in to the pads and Johnson can't connect
a single only for Johnson as he pulls another quick ball down towards long on
drifts on to the pads of Ferguson, who clips through leg and picks up a single - ah, but the throw is messy and Prior can't collect, and that allows an overthrow
Johnson uses the feet now but turns this delivery into a yorker and can only push it back to KP
a good, straight-bat push through extra cover now and Johnson picks up two runs
fullish and on the pads, Johnson can't beat square leg
again Johnson advances, and this one is a full toss that he drives down the ground for two more
chipped down the ground towards long-on for a single
not a great ball, well wide of off, and Ferguson cuts through point
shortish to start with and Trott is perhaps lucky to get away with that, Johnson pulls a single to deep square leg

tucked away through square leg for a single, but that's not the story here. Kevin Pietersen is the fielder and he's twisted his right ankle sliding to collect the ball, and he immediately goes down, not throwing the ball in. He looks in pain, getting some attention from the physio.
Johnson punches this through cover for another single
pushed away to point and can't find a gap
Ferguson backs off a touch and pulls hard through square leg but can't find a boundary
on the pads now and Johnson flicks another couple of runs behind square
Ferguson backs off and gives himself a little room again, then punches through cover point
a crunchy back-foot drive from Johnson flies through the air at cover, and he picks up two to the man in the deep
flicks another single through the leg side now
solidly defended by Ferguson
tries to power this one through cover but Strauss has fielded it well
pushed just wide enough of cover to collect a run
a lucky single to third man now as Ferguson backs off and tries to drive through cover, getting an edge through the vacant slips region
driven uppishly now, it bounces down towards long-on
Ferguson is happy to pick up the singles when they're on offer, another clip behind square leg
on the back foot, Johnson punches a drive that can't quite beat mid-off
a solid back-foot drive through cover now and Wright in the deep does the fielding, sliding well to save the boundary
this one gets through mid-off but again there is a man in the deep
banged in short by Woakes, and Johnson pulls comfortably to deep midwicket
a wristy flick from Ferguson finds him two more runs through midwicket, these two really are ticking the score along, even if the boundaries aren't flowing
again Ferguson gives himself room and cuts hard through point
slower ball from Woakes and Johnson has picked it, punching it back past the bowler, the ball flicks one of those run-up marker discs and is collected by long-on
very well played by Ferguson, he's walked across just a touch to work this one from middle stump behind square leg. Fine leg is up, deep square can't get it , and that's a valuable boundary
square-driven now through point
Ferguson tries to drive through cover but can't find the gap
another boundary for Ferguson, as he backs off and crunches Trott over cover, clearing the man safely enough and there is nobody in the deep
slower ball from Trott - which is to say, even slower - and Ferguson flicks it through square leg
Johnson flicks this one through square leg and it's collected in the deep
slower and fuller, Johnson clips to midwicket

Johnson goes for it and just clear the rope! He's decided to go after Trott and lifted him over midwicket, there's a man back on the boundary, it's Woakes, and he wasn't far off being able to reach it, but couldn't quite make it. In fact, on second inspection, it may have flicked his fingers on the way through. Half a chance, perhaps.
a well-timed sweep from Ferguson, but straight to the man at deep midwicket
Johnson uses his feet but Yardy spears it in, and the ball is pushed back to him
Johnson turns another one into a yorker by advancing, can only clip to leg
another dot as Johnson flicks to midwicket, the quicker balls are hard to get away

oh dear, Ferguson and Johnson had done so well but they've really messed this up. Johnson tried to slog sweep, it lobbed off his pad out to the leg side and Ferguson toook off for a single that Mitch wasn't ready for, Ferguson turns back but has no hope of beating the throw from Prior to Yardy
Johnson pushes another one defensively back to Yardy
flicked through midwicket for a single, Clarke is off the mark immediately
this ball skids across Johnson, who tries to force through off but misses it
Johnson glides this one away and Finn at short third man dives across to save a boundary
slower ball now and Clarke drives to cover
Clarke goes for the pull over midwicket now, and the man in the deep does the fielding
fullish and straight, Johnson checks his drive and gets a single through leg
quick, flat ball from Yardy - surprise, surprise - and Johnson punches a single to long-on
Yardy flights it more for Clarke, who uses his feet and pushes a single to long-on
quick again, and Johnson clips through midwicket for a pretty comfortable two
defended away to the off side
leans forward to this one and it gets him on the pad
nudged to leg and Johnson can't quite find his fifty yet
a boundary to begin with as Anderson strays on to the pads, and Clarke glances fine, well played to get his first boundary
driven down to mid-on
Clarke walks down the pitch a little and defends
slower delivery from Anderson, and Clarke defends
oooh, almost another mix-up as Clarke drives and wants a single to mid-off but then decides against it, just in time
pushes this one through wide mid-on for a single
driven down to long-on for another single
there's the half-century for Johnson, his second in ODIs, and it comes with a single clipped through square leg
Clarke is happy to keep the singles ticking over, with another drive to long-off
Johnson uses the feet now, but just gets a single from his lofted drive to deep wide mid-on
cut through cover for another one
Johnson clips through midwicket and they want to turn this into two, but Johnson has slipped during the turn
cleverly chipped through midwicket as Johnson just waits on this ball and turns it wide of the fielder
Clarke has gone for the aerial pull off the front foot now and skies it off the top edge, but this lands safely halfway to the rope and he gets two runs
a very sharp single as Clarke pushes to backward point, Johnson was just quick enough to make it, although the throw missed in any case
Johnson goes for the backswing as if he's thinking big, and then checks it and defends
good ball, that's fullish and straight, and Johnson keeps it out
very well played as Johnson drives straight back past the bowler and long-on and long-off converge to cut off the boundary
clipped to midwicket and can't find a gap
Clarke uses the feet now and drives to long-on
tossed up outside off, Johnson defends
Johnson's eyes light up now, not surprisingly, as he advances and lofts high over mid-off, trying to clear the rope. He doesn't connect properly, and it lobs safely short of long-off
this time Johnson is gone! Pietersen makes the breakthrough, giving it some air and pushing it well wide of off, Johnson was down the pitch again, but couldn't connect, and Prior whips the bails off
White defends his first ball as Pietersen gets one to turn in to the batsman
late cut from Clarke, who gets a single to third man
a big shout of 'no, no!' from White as he pushes to cover, where Pietersen collects and then gingerly hops around a bit
driven uppishly through cover point to get White off the mark
slower ball now and Clarke pushes to backward point
flicked to leg, and Clarke can't find a gap
nudged away to the off side and Clarke can't find a gap
White nudges a single away to the off side
tossed up outside off and Clarke looks for the slog sweep, but just gets it along the ground through midwicket
is that dropped? Possibly a thin edge there as he pushes outside off and Prior can't glove it. Hard to tell if there was bat on that, but by the reaction of the England players, perhaps.
punched through cover for some runs
defended back down the pitch
clipped through leg again
a meaty pull to start proceedings, the ball flies in the air but well short of the men out on the leg boundary
Clarke follows White's example, in his own way - pulling all along the ground out to the same fielder
drop-and-run from White, good awareness from both batsmen
well, a better throw and that could well have been out! Clarke clipped out to long leg and turned quickly for the second, Trott rifled in the throw but it came to Prior with an awkward bounce
tapped away on the off side this time, these two keeping things ticking over nicely
on a length and straight, White aims a defensive push to mid-on
good use of the feet from Clarke, as we've come to expect from him. He gets nicely to the pitch and cracks the ball down the ground for one
good placement from White, the ball was short and quite wide and he picked out the gap behind square. Good ground fielding out in the deep keeps them to two, however
flatter from KP, pushed back to the bowler
a rifling mow flies into the crowd at wide long-on! The ball falls right into a crowded section of the ground, leaving one female spectator with a startled look on her face. No harm done though
huge appeal for caught behind, Harper says no, and they'll review this ... Well, upon replay it doesn't look like he's got anywhere near that. Nothing on HotSpot. Yep, not out is the call
flat on off stump to finish, the ball squirts off the outer half of the bat and goes to point
back of a length and rising, Clarke gets nicely across and tucks off his hip out to deep square leg
fuller this time, but nicely straight again. White is upset with himself for not making more of that, but it was a decent delivery

thrashed! An atrocious ball from Woakes, short and wide and just begging to be hit. White was camped on the front foot but he had all the time he needed to scythe through the line and send the ball screaming to the cover boundary
water-tight defence to follow that up. Not something you'd usually associate with Cameron White, but he looked utterly solid as he propped forward
tapped into the covers, an easy one
again worked off the hip by Clarke, the placement is good so they're back for the second

he picks up a wicket first ball, the dangerous White departs! It was short and rising to about neck height, White swivelled into pull but couldn't control the shot and the ball lands in Eoin Morgan's hands out at deep square leg. He barely had to move there. Finn, who tumbled over in his follow-through as he does so often, stood up just in time to see the catch taken
again Finn tastes the dirt, tumbling over after he lets the ball go. It's a good delivery to receive first ball, rising and wrapping him on the glove
Hussey is off the mark, swiping out into the leg side. Morgan does well once again, sprinting round and saving two runs
tapped to mid-on, there's no run there
pushed into the off side this time, again he hits the field
slower ball from Finn, a cutter, and this time a single is the result as the ball is placed in gently into the gap at cover
not much flight, but some grip and turn for Pietersen. Punched down to long-on
speared down the leg side this time, that's wide
KP holds this one back as Clarke advances down the track, good bowling
but that definitel isn't good bowling, short - a long-hop - and Clarke steps back to pull to midwicket, the ball pinging out of the middle and evading the fielders
short again, not punished quite as severely this time as Clarke picks up one to cover point
driven back hard to the bowler
worked beind square on the leg side
well, an extra ball to the over! What's more, it results in a single - England will be glad it's only a single
short, pulled hard into the leg side but there's protection out there
length from Finn, Hussey gives himself room and picks up one to deep cover
glanced away down to fine leg
effort ball from Finn, and Hussey is beaten attempting to force through the off side
this time he plays for the extra bounce, staying deep and standing tall to run it down to third man
Finn attacks the body as Clarke shuffles to off, and he's called wide. Fair enough, good call

Finn has been England's most impressive bowler today and he continues to look dangerous. This time he beats the inside edge of the bat with a touch of seam movement and some flat-footed prodding from Clarke
quick single to start the over
this looked like a slower ball, hammered out into the deep on the leg side
driven to mid-off, they take the single
effort ball from Woakes, a touch of movement and bounce and Hussey is beaten
this time it's an excellent piece of fielding that keeps the batsmen quiet, Anderson leaping like a salmon at point to stop a powerful cut
another slower ball, clipped to fine leg
Hussey gives himself some room and tries to force through the off side
Hussey is struggling slightly with the extra bounce, again Finn bends his back to beat the edge of an attempted glide to third man

a nervous shot, and some frenetic running! Hussey drove in the air, the ball dipping and dropping just short of mid-off. They also took off for a single that never was, and had the throw been better Hussey could've been run out too
full, Clarke makes room but can't get it away
Clarke rides the bounce to send the ball down to third man ... he call's for the second and comes charging back, good running in the end as he was safely home
Finn hits the deck hard but Clarke deals with the extra bounce well, getting on top of the ball to pick up one behind point. There's Australia's 250
just a touch too short from Yardy, Clarke steps back and aims a good-looking back-foot punch out to the cover boundary, but Morgan sprints round to cut it off
short from Yardy again, but once more Clarke can't make the most of it. He gets a good connection on the pull out to midwicket, but can't find the gap
again not quite full enough, Clarke hops back and cuts out to deep cover
dragged down short and fast, Hussey pulls along the ground and out to the fielder in the deep
a touch fuller, and quick too, but short enough that Clarke decides to play off the back foot. Straight to cover
cut off middle stump! A brave shot for just one run
back of a length, tapped out into the off side
Hussey now working the ball away from one
Clarke jumps down the track but can't get it away, Anderson fields in his follow-through
reverse-swing! Definite movement through the air, out of nowhere, and it's quite exaggerated. A bit of inside edge on the clip to leg and they get one
more reverse for Anderson, Hussey steps back and goes over the cover field ... but yet again Morgan is on hand with some tireless fielding on the boundary to save two runs. Good stuff
cracked away off the back foot for one, into the off side
and he's in action straight away, driven down the ground
quicker ball from Yardy, practically medium pace and Hussey nudges him between square leg and fine leg for a quick single
tapped down the ground, and there's Clarke's fifty
tapped into the leg side, just the one
confusion! It was clipped to leg, the one was always on but there was no communication from the batsmen as they looked for the second. No harm done though
pushed into the off side for one, and that ends a good day with the ball for Yardy

shot! Clarke can really hit them when he wants to. This was not a slog by any means, or if it was it was a graceful one. Anderson strayed onto the pads, Clarke got insde the line and just lifted it over square leg. The ball never got up too high but it was easily six. Short boundary out there, 67 metres
driven down the ground
four more, stroked through the covers! Clarke walked down the track, Anderson went wider but the batsman was right to the pitch and picked the gap in the off side field. Damaging for England!
two more, this over's had good shots and some equally good running. Driven down to long-on, they turn immediately for the second - no hesitation - and he's easily home
Anderson is slightly spooked here, he aims for the yorker but sends it down the leg side
Clarke walks across to the off side as Anderson sends down a slower offcutter, whipping out to deep midwicket
good finish to the over, Anderson sends down a pinpoint yorker. Hussey jams down on it and they pick up just one as the ball rolls into the leg side and the bowler sprints after it himself

speared down the leg side to start, Prior appeals but is that just to try and hoodwink the umpire into not calling a wide? He's called wide, but Prior runs in and speaks to Strauss ... and they're going to review it! Nope, nothing to suggest that's hit either bat or pad. England out of reviews now

chipped over cover, and that bounces away for four! The bowler had done really well, sending down a great slower ball that completely deceived the batsman. But Hussey went through with the shot, found space and on a quick outfield the ball couldn't be hauled in
full on off stump, dug out to mid-off - who is on the edge of the circle - and they take one
Clarke backs away to leg, giving himself acres of room, but just one run the result as he drills it down to long-on
Hussey drives down to that man at long-on this time
nicely whipped out into the deep on the leg side, Clarke called for two straight away. Great running
the ball flies between batsman and stumps as Clarke backs a good three feet away to leg and Woakes follows him. The batsman swishes and misses, the ball zips through to the keeper. Dot ball
Hussey swings slightly wildly to leg, the ball takes the inside edge/toe of the bat and trickles to long-on
this would've been a good reverse-swinging yorker had Clarke stayed put in the crease, but he walks down to turn it into a full toss and clips to leg
Hussey brings up Australia's 300 with a big six over long-off! Superb hitting, he stepped down the track, taking it on the half volley, and committed himself fully to the stroke. An 88 metre hit
full, Hussey swings but he can't put it away
Hussey's turning it on here! Anderson sends down a high full toss, the batsman backs away to leg and sends it racing away through cover
cracked to long-on, and again great running as they're back for the second. Big cheers from the crowd!
low, dipping full-toss and Clarke pushes down to long-on
Finn keeps his cool as Hussey charges him, going slightly wider and beating his outside edge
Hussey backs away this time, the ball takes the inside edge and bounces straight to Trott at short fine leg, but they're off for the single straight away
Finn continues to impress, hitting a great length and beating the outside edge of Clarke's bat now
that won't please him, though. Finn aims for a slower-ball bouncer but it's misdirected down the leg side
full pace on the delivery, but now it's a full toss and Clarke slaps him down the ground

got him! Finn strikes, after beating the outside edge a couple of times he sends down another slower cutter on a length and this time the ball kisses the edge of Hussey's flailing bat. Straight through to Prior, the celebrations are very muted indeed but that's given England a chance
leg-stump full-toss, Clarke could've made more of that. He picks up the single out to long leg
a touch of wobble in through the air, Smith drives down the ground ... they think about the two, but no, it'll just be one
defended to cover point

the disaster that was waiting to happen! Clipped straight to a sliding midwicket fielder, Australian batsmen running all over the place and Haddin is well short of his ground as the throw comes in to Anderson. He and Smith trudge off, heads bowed
driven with plenty of wrist and bottom hand, down to long-on
feisty short ball from Anderson to finish his spell, Hastings hops but keeps his bat inside the line

dropped by Trott at short fine leg! He'd had such a good day until this moment, Clarke walked across to off and flicked uppishly, the ball flew in the air and Trott leapt but just tipped it over the bar - getting a hand to it but he just couldn't hold on. And he took such a good catch in that position earlier!
leading edge as Clarke looks to work to leg, into the covers and they steal a quick single
smell that! A well-directed bouncer from Finn and Hastings is in no position to play it. The ball bursts past his grille. That's one for the over
that's in the air ... but safe! Hastings heaved a length delivery high into the leg side, two fielders chased after it but their tag-team effort goes slightly awry and they're back for three
slower-ball bouncer, Clarke aims a well-controlled paddle-pull into the deep. They push hard for the second ... but he's short of his ground! Clarke is run out and Australia are eight wickets down
rising towards the hip, Lee doesn't know too much about it as the ball takes the thigh pad and lobs up in the air towards square leg ... eventually Hastings calls him through
not the best start, he's slammed that down halfway down and that's ballooned way, way over the batsman's head
full and fast, Lee drives and a thick outside edge flies down to third man ... just the single
there it is! The runs count no matter how you get them, Hastings swings and a thick inside edge rolls down to the fine leg boundary. The Duke has done it for Australia at the death
